chapter.para: The various components of &productname; authenticate to each other using passwords that are automatically managed by the ∩ secrets-generator. The only passwords managed by the cluster administrator are passwords for human users. The administrator may create and remove user logins, but cannot change user passwords.

listitem.para: The cluster administrator password is initially defined in the deployment's values.yaml file with CLUSTER_ADMIN_PASSWORD
The Stratos Web UI provides a form for users, including the administrator, to change their own passwords
User logins are created (and removed) with the Cloud Foundry Client, &cfcli;

sect1.title: Password Management with the Cloud Foundry Client
sect1.para: The administrator cannot change other users' passwords. Only users may change their own passwords, and password changes require the current password:
sect1.screen: &prompt.user;cf passwd Current Password> New Password> Verify Password> Changing password... OK Please log in again

Use the &cfcli; to assign space and org roles. Run cf help -a for a complete command listing, or see Creating and Managing Users with the &cfcli;.

sect1.title: Changing User Passwords with Stratos
sect1.para: The Stratos Web UI provides a form for changing passwords on your profile page. Click the overflow menu button on the top right to access your profile, then click the edit button on your profile page. You can manage your password and username on this page.
